Dear Heather L Calcaterra:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
3/21/25. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan
is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective action
plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed or
implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4153 Shelter care and detention institutions; preliminary
service plans
• (1) Within 7 calendar days of admission, a
plan shall be developed for each resident. The
plan shall include all of the following:
• (b) An assessment of the resident's
immediate and specific needs.
One out of six preliminary plans reviewed did not assess the immediate needs of
the youth. Based on the intake, the youth was placed on a safety plan due to self-
harming behaviors. The preliminary plan did not note this as an immediate need.
2

CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan
• (1) When a resident is discharged from
institutional care, all of the following
information shall be documented in the case
record within 14 days after discharge:
• (e) A statement that the discharge plan
recommendations, including medical
and dental follow up that is needed,
have been reviewed with the resident
and with the parent and with the
responsible case manager.
Two out of eight case records did not provide a statement including medical and
dental follow up was reviewed with the resident and the parent.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical assistance was offered with R.400.4153. Preliminary service plans all
noted the same "cut and paste" assessments. Although all youth need the same
services (food, shelter, clothing, medical), this form is to be client-centered and
speak specifically to the youth's immediate needs. Violation was found in a
youth's file due to not noting in the preliminary report the self-harming behaviors
seen at intake. Supervisors are to ensure "cutting and pasting" are not occurring
in reports and should be looking at intake documents as well as initial behaviors of
the youth to determine the immediate needs before signing off on reports. The
agency will want to retrain supervisors and staff on writing and approving reports.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
3

There was one Corrective Action Plan (CAP) during this reporting period. The
CAP was in response to 2025SIC0000336; CAP approved on 3/12/25. The
corrective action plan has not been fully completed at this time. The agency was in
violation of R.400.4159. The actions steps are not due to be completed until
3/28/25.
Financial Overview
Not applicable.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was completed. Children's Village reviews
policies, procedures, and youth case files on an on-going basis. Annual training is
completed and this past year they added a Training and Development Specialist.
All physical managements have been reviewed with administration and camera
footage if available. Children's Village is working toward PREA certification and
report they are in compliance with PREA standards.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted and there are no concerns noted. Staff felt that
trainings were informative and helpful. Staff felt the program was impactful to the
youth.
Youth interviewed reported they are provided with everything that they need. Youth
reported staff are respectful and helpful. No concerns were noted.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility is well maintained and clean. School areas were inviting. There are no
concerns.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
